summary: ESPN, originally the Entertainment and Sports Programming Network, is an American sports channel owned by The Walt Disney Company (80%) and Hearst Communications (20%). Founded in 1979 by Bill Rasmussen, Scott Rasmussen, and Ed Eagan, it broadcasts from Bristol, Connecticut, with additional offices in several U.S. cities. James Pitaro has been the chairman since 2018. ESPN reaches about 70 million U.S. homes and operates internationally in Africa, Australia, Latin America, and the Netherlands. It also has a stake in Canada's TSN networks. Despite its popularity, ESPN faces criticism for biased coverage and conflicts of interest.
title: ESPN
